column4: I may be a demi-god, but I've never seen a case quite like this.
column6: I am going to have to send you back, but I can't just put you back into your body.
column7: In order to re-inhabit your body, you will need to first prevent your initial death.
column8: That's not going to be easy. Despite your cultures myths about ghosts; spirits like you have very little ability to interact with the real world.
column9: The best arrow in your quiver is the ability to slightly influence others emotions, as well as hear what they are thinking in the moment.
column10: Another issue is that your corporeal memories don't transfer with you in spirit form, you'll have to piece it together yourself.
column11: One more thing and this is important.
column12: When you go back, you will be put in the world the morning the day you died.
column13: If you reach the end of the day and didn't prevent your death, you will reset the day along with everything you've changed.
column14: Feel free to experiment and make wrong choices if you'd like to see what happens.
column15: You can always reset to the beginning of the day again.
column16: Open the time menu anywhere to advance time.
